events.name: Maker Immersion Camp 2015
events.description:
Here is a chance for students aged 10-14 to collaborate for Maker Camp 2015. 

Learn: Woodworking, microcontrollers, Programming, Electronics, Fabric Hacking, Design thinking. 

Soft skills: Testing, tinkering, project design, teamwork, collaboration

events.name: Bringing Design To Healthcare
events.description:
How do you bring design thinking and research into the healthcare system? Why does it matter to patients like us? What's it got to do with makers and technologists?  Our next speaker for the Singapore Geek Girls meetup is Tan Liren. In this talk, Liren will share about her work and journey in taking design concepts to improve the local healthcare system.  Join us on the coming Monday evening to hear more from her! 


Details:  Monday, 30 November 7PM - 830PM Paypal @ Suntec 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore 038985 


 Tan Liren, Senior Industrial Designer As an industrial designer in the innovation and research department in Alexandra Health System, Liren leads the user-centric research and design efforts that focuses on identifying the un-met needs of the users, and enhancing their experience within the system.  Her past projects include research and design around the delivery of care for ophthalmology patients, the redesign of the A&E experience and a prototype clinic to change the behavior of chronic patients. She is also involved in the creation of a comprehensive design-thinking curriculum, together with her team, to spread the culture of innovation within the hospital. Liren holds a Bachelor of Arts (Hons) in industrial design from National University of Singapore, where she received the NUS Innovation/Practicuum Award in recognition of her work involving design to help the special needs population. 


*As usual, all members of the public are welcome to attend! Feel free to bring along a girl who might be interested!  Special thanks to Paypal for sponsoring the venue for our talk! :)
events.location: Paypal at Suntec , 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #015
events.description:
Paper #1: Breaking Through the Normalization Barrier:
A Self-Interpreter for F-omega : Matt Brown, Jens Palsberg (http://compilers.cs.ucla.edu/popl16/popl16-full.pdf) - Érdi Gergő

Paper #2: Deep learning : Yann LeCun, Yoshua Bengio & Geoffrey Hinton - Shawn Tan

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT
